transportAdvice: Cuenca's historic center is compact and very walkable, with most major attractions within comfortable walking distance of each other. The city has a public bus network that covers tourist areas, and taxis are widely available and affordable for longer journeys.

weather.description: January falls in the wet season with frequent afternoon showers and overcast skies, though mornings are often clear.
February continues with heavy rainfall typical of the wet season, with lush green landscapes as a result.
March is one of the wettest months of the year, with persistent rain and mild temperatures throughout.
April remains rainy and humid, though temperatures stay mild and the city's parks and gardens are vibrant.
May marks a gradual transition toward drier conditions, with fewer showers and more sunny intervals.
June is one of the driest and sunniest months, with clear skies and pleasant daytime temperatures ideal for sightseeing.
July offers dry, sunny weather with cool nights, making it one of the best months to visit Cuenca.
August is typically the driest month of the year, with warm days, cool nights, and excellent visibility.
September sees the return of some rainfall as the wet season begins to establish, though conditions remain generally pleasant.
October brings increasing cloud cover and afternoon showers, signaling the transition back into the wetter season.
November is notably wet with frequent rain, though the city remains lively and temperatures stay mild.
December is rainy and festive, with holiday celebrations adding color to the wet and overcast conditions.
